name: Cantila Beach
description: You reach the water's edge. The stones almost sing as they roll back and forth in the waves. A large lighthouse towers in the west, while the path continues eastward into a small fishing town.

name: Uragota Town
description: The small town is quite lively. Situated on the main coastline road, there are a number of shops and an inn to stay at. The road leads through the town and out of sight along the coast.

buildings.name: Kazkagrin's Fortunes
buildings.description: A poorly lit room is surrounded on all sides by maps, clocks, and tapestries. A strange man sits hunched over a table, awaiting your arrival.

name: West Uragota Docks
description: The western side of the docks is mostly used for smaller boats. A number of fishermen sit at the edge with lines in the water. There's also a kiosk with a sign saying, "Boats Fore Sail" in poorly written letters on the front.

buildings.name: Mound's Boats
buildings.description: The kiosk is run by a man named Gordo, who greets you nervously as you approach him. It appears to be selling both large and small fishing vessels.

name: East Uragota Docks
description: The eastern side of the docks contains the larger fishing vessels, as well as a ferry service to the Hojkma Isles.

buildings.name: Pirate's Ship
buildings.description: You're standing on the deck of a large, wooden ship.

name: Darkbourne Bridge
description: The river is muddied by runoff from the nearby farmland. It's shallow and wide, a great place to catch carp or other river fish. You can see a wooded area beyond the bridge to the east.

buildings.name: Mound's House
buildings.description: The house sits on a small hill aside the river. The front door is locked. You'll have to find some other way inside.

name: Ocean Fishing Platform
description: The fishing platform floats out in the ocean, just barely in sight of shore. Many large fish gather beneath here for some reason.
